Ein Parcours durch die Arenenberger Viel: A journey through the diversity of Arenenberg
Willkommen im Arenenberger Milchviehstal: Welcome to the Arenenberg dairy barn!
Du begleitest die Kuh Frida durch einen: Accompany Frida the Cow on a typical April day and learn about the work done in the Arenenberg dairy barn. Choose a character and click the time of day that interests you on the time line! You’ll learn useful information about the staff’s duties in the barn and about the animals at Arenenberg. Then, you can take a quiz to test your knowledge! Have fun!
Danke fürs Mitmachen! Du kennst dich jet: Thank you for taking the quiz! You know your way around the Arenenberg dairy barn really well now.
Folgen Sie einem typischen Apriltag eine: Follow a typical April day of a cow in the Arenenberg dairy cowshed! Frida is a five-year-old dairy cow. She has calved twice and provides an average of 25 litres of milk per day.
Frida geht auf die Weide. Sie frisst jun: Frida goes to the pasture. She eats fresh, green grass. This is very nutritious fodder.
Frida und die anderen Kühe am Arenenberg: Frida and the other cows at Arenenberg have a considerable amount of freedom. They decide for themselves when to eat and drink, when to lie down and when to be milked.
Frida geht zurück zum Stall. Sie freut s: Frida returns to her cowshed. She is looking forward to her next course, i.e. the bait pellets waiting for her by the milking robot.
Die Kühe sollen möglichst viel junges Gr: The cows should eat as much fresh grass as possible on the pasture, but not all day long. They need to be milked at least twice per day. The cows can graze down a pasture of this size within a few hours. They return to the cowshed before noon for milking in the knowledge that they will be allowed back onto a fresh, new pasture in the afternoon.
Frida steht im Melkroboter. Sie frisst l: Frida is standing by the milking robot. She eats delicious fodder and is being milked. The milking robot always milks the cows in the same, patient way. Frida finds it a pleasant experience.
Die Kühe werden mit Futter in den Melkro: The cows are enticed into the milking robot with fodder. They are milked by an automatic milking system. It's stress-free and does not take very long. The cows need to be milked at least twice per day.
Besonders nach dem Melken, aber auch imm: Frida drinks fresh water from the trough, especially after milking but also in between, averaging about 120 litres per day. After eating the fresh, green grass, Frida would like something dry and high in fibre. She eats hay at the feed alley. Hay is an ideal complement to young grass, and stabilises Frida's digestion.
Der Melkroboter und ein Sensor am Halsba: The milking robot and a sensor on the cow’s collar collect information about the milk and the cow, for example, about the quality of the milk or the cows' activity. It also provides information about the cow's health.
Frida will sich ausruhen und legt sich i: Frida wants to rest and lies down in the freshly sprinkled sawdust. Beforehand, she carries out her personal hygiene routine and lets the automatic livestock brush remove the dust from her hide.
Der Kompostierungsstall bietet den Kühen: The composting barn provides the cows with plenty of comfortable material to lie on and plenty of freedom to move about. The floor is covered with fresh bedding material such as sawdust. The bedding material, dung and urine of the cows produce a rich compost, which is then spread on the fields as fertiliser.
Es ist Zeit, nochmals auf die Weide zu g: It’s time to go grazing again. Frida goes to the pasture gate and is allowed onto a new, fresh pasture with lush grass.
Die Kühe werden über das Weidetor gesteu: The cows are controlled via the pasture gate. The pasture gate only lets them onto the pasture if they were last milked less than seven hours ago. Otherwise, they are led back to the cowshed for milking before they are released.
Satt gefressen begibt sich Frida zurück: Her hunger stilled, Frida returns to the cowshed and is milked again. She then chooses whether to spend the night in the cowshed or outdoors on the pasture.
Folgen Sie einem typischen Arbeitstag de: Follow a farmer's typical working day at the Arenenberg dairy cowshed!
Der Bauer startet um 6 Uhr seine Arbeit: The farmer starts work at the Arenenberg dairy cowshed at 6 a.m. The day ends at 6 p.m. First, the farmer checks the milk tank (temperature, filter). Every now and then he is surprised to find a newly born calf standing next to its mother. Calving takes place during the night in about ninety percent of cases.
Der Arenenberger Milchviehstall bietet d: The Arenenberg dairy cowshed provides the cows with maximum lying comfort and plenty of freedom to move. This allows them to give birth to their calves in a stress-free environment. The young animals don't suffer from the low temperatures in the cowshed, but they don't like draughty conditions.
Der Bauer reinigt mit Wasser den Melkrob: The farmer cleans the milking robot and the cows' standing area with water. He heats the milk for the calves to a maximum of 42 degrees Celsius. The information collected by the automatic milking system tells the farmer whether a cow is in season or sick. He takes appropriate measures and has the cow inseminated or treated.
Der Bauer säubert die Futterkrippe. Mit: The farmer cleans the manger. He uses a crane to distribute first- and second-cut hay. From August onwards, the farmer also gives the cows fresh maize. In winter, he supplies each cow with ten kilograms of carrots or beetroot, four kilograms of whole maize pellets and about two kilograms of sugar beet pulp.
Im Winter gibt es kein frisches Gras für: In winter, there is no fresh grass for the cows, only hay and dried fodder. The hay must be actively dried in the haystack using warm air to ensure that it maintains its quality and taste.
Der Bauer überprüft das Kraftfuttersilo: The farmer checks the fodder silo and the mineral container. Then he turns his attention to feeding the calves, checking their water and replenishing their fodder. Finally, he mucks their shed out, replaces the bedding, wipes the forecourt and cleans the so-called milk taxi. This mobile milk tank supplies the young animals with milk.
Der Bauer fräst die Liegeflächen, damit: The farmer rakes the lying areas so that the dung and urine are well mixed to allow optimum composting.
Bei der Reinigung des Stallbodens wird d: The farmer uses a robotic vacuum to clean the floor in the cowshed. Every ninety minutes it follows a programmed route and vacuums and turns the dung. It irrigates and rinses the walkway.
Der Bauer geht zu den Leghennen im mobil: The farmer goes to the laying hens in the mobile coop on the pasture. He removes the eggs, checks the feed and the water levels and whether the 350 or so chickens are healthy. He then turns his attention to the 20 or so sheep. He checks the animals, their water and feed, the fence and the bedding in the barn. He also checks to see whether any lambs have been born during the night.
Wenn die Tiere versorgt sind, nimmt der: Once he's seen to the animals, the farmer tends to the other jobs in the barn or on the pasture such as haymaking, tilling the fields or making any repairs.
Für den Folgetag richtet der Bauer zwei: The farmer prepares two new pasture paddocks for the following day.
Der Bauer widmet sich erneut der Stallar: The farmer returns to the cowshed to see to any jobs there such as warming the milk for de calves, watering the calves, feeding the cows, cleaning the appliances.
Die Liegefläche der Kühe wird gefräst, F: He rakes their bedding, tops up the fodder and water and checks on the animals.
Eine Schlusskontrolle bei den Leghennen: The farmer finishes his working day at in the Arenenberg dairy cowshed with a final check on the laying hens and scattering fresh grain.
Wieviele Kühe leben im Arenenberger Milc: How many cows live in the Arenenberg dairy cowshed?
Wie alt sind die Kühe im Arenenberger Mi: What is the average age of the cows in the Arenenberg dairy cowshed?
Was lockt die Kühe auf die Weide?: What attracts the cows to the pasture?
Wieviel Liter Milch gibt eine Kuh im Dur: How many litres of milk does a cow produce per day on average?
Wie oft werden die Kühe pro Tag gemolken: How often are the cows milked per day?
Wieviel Wasser trinkt eine Kuh im Durchs: How much water does a cow drink on average per day?
Worauf liegen die Kühe im Arenenberger S: What do the cows in the Arenenberg cowshed lie on?
Wann werden die meisten Kälber geboren?: When are the majority of calves born?
Wie warm darf die Milch für die Kälber m: What is the maximum milk temperature for the calves?
Was ist das Hauptnahrungsmittel der Kuh?: What is the main food eaten by cows?
Wieviele Hühner leben im mobilen Hühners: How many chickens live in the mobile chicken coop at Arenenberg?
